fields.name: primaryAccountNumber
fields.description: Primary account number (PAN) of the card that is being tokenized. cvv2 (Optional) Value associated with the PAN on the card.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Full name on the Visa card associated with the enrolled payment instrument. 27 March 2025 Visa Confidential 56

fields.name: expirationDate
fields.description: The expiration date of the payment instrument. This is a required field for Secure Remote Commerce and in the following APIs:

fields.name: billingAddress
fields.description: Billing address associated with the payment instrument. It is required for Secure Remote Commerce.

fields.name: highValueCustomer
fields.description: If available, it will be provided in Check Eligibility. • true-- Indicates that the customer is high value. • false-- Indicates that the customer is not high value.
fields.format: It is one of the following values:

fields.name: riskAssessmentScore
fields.description: Advanced Authorization (AA) Risk Score is generated by VisaNet on the last payment transaction for the PAN. Values are 0 through 99, with a higher value indicating higher risk. This value is calculated by the AA Risk engine, based on the PAN’s transaction pattern (long-term and short-term). If available, it will be provided in Check Eligibility.

fields.name: Address
fields.description: This structure is used by several APIs.

fields.name: city
fields.description: City associated with the address. (.), single quote (‘), asterisk (*), and hyphens (-) are allowed; max length 32 characters.
fields.format: String; alphanumeric; UTF-8, white space, carat (^), period

fields.name: state
fields.description: State or province code associated with the address.

fields.name: postalCode
fields.description: The postal code associated with the address. and hyphens (-) are allowed; max length 10 characters.
fields.format: String; alphanumeric, valid for the country; whitespace

fields.name: country
fields.description: Code for a country; default is US.
fields.format: String; ISO 3166-1 alpha-2; max length 2 characters.

fields.name: month
fields.description: The month upon which the payment instrument is set to expire.

fields.name: year
fields.description: The year upon which the payment instrument is set to expire. Visa Token Service - Issuer API Specifications (JSON) Encrypted Payload Data Structures 27 March 2025 Visa Confidential 58

fields.name: token
fields.description: The account number associated with a token. This is a required field in the following APIs:

fields.name: tokenType
fields.description: This is a required field in the following APIs:
fields.format: It is one of the following values:

fields.name: tokenStatus
fields.description: This is a required field in the following APIs:
fields.format: It is one of the following values:

fields.name: tokenExpirationDate
fields.description: The date upon which the token is set to expire. This field is required in the Token Create Notification API. It is provided in the Token Notification API request if available. Visa Token Service - Issuer API Specifications (JSON) Encrypted Payload Data Structures 27 March 2025 Visa Confidential 59

fields.name: tokenAssuranceMethod
fields.description: Method of Issuer ID&V that has taken place at time of provisioning, device binding, or cardholder initiated verification. It is one of the following values:
values: 11 Card Issuer Interactive Cardholder Verification - 1 Factor
12 Card Issuer Interactive Cardholder Verification - 2 Factor
13 Card Issuer Risk Oriented Non-Interactive Cardholder

fields.name: Authentication
fields.description: • 14 Card Issuer Asserted Authentication

fields.name: numberOfActiveTokensForPAN
fields.description: Number of device tokens that are currently active for this PAN.

fields.name: numberOfInactiveTokensForPAN
fields.description: Number of device tokens that are currently inactive (device tokens have not been activated) for this PAN.

fields.name: numberOfSuspendedTokensForPAN
fields.description: Number of device tokens that were activated, but are suspended for payments for this PAN.

fields.name: tokenActivationDate
fields.description: System date/timestamp, in GMT, of token activation into an active state. For an inactive state, this field is left empty and populated only when a token transitions to an active state. If a token is suspended, this field is populated with the new date/ timestamp of when an active state resumes.

fields.name: tokenDeactivationDate
fields.description: Date of token deactivation.

fields.name: lastTokenStatusUpdatedTime
fields.description: Date/timestamp, in GMT, of the last token status update.

fields.name: originalToken
fields.description: Token account number. This field is populated when performing token-for-token provisioning only.

fields.name: originalTokenRequestorID
fields.description: Unique ID assigned to the initiator of the token request. This field is populated when performing token-for-token provisioning only. Visa Token Service - Issuer API Specifications (JSON) Encrypted Payload Data Structures 27 March 2025 Visa Confidential 60

fields.name: originalTokenReferenceID
fields.description: Unique ID for the token associated with the PAN. This ID can be used in lieu of the token for subsequent calls, such as life cycle events. This field is populated when performing token-for- token provisioning only.

fields.name: originalTokenType
fields.description: Token type of the original token. This field is populated only when performing token for token provisioning and can be used only in the following APIs:
fields.format: It is one of the following values:

fields.name: originaltokenAssuranceMethod
fields.description: Original token assurance method. This field is populated when performing token-for-token provisioning only. It is one of the following values:
values: 11 Card Issuer Interactive Cardholder Verification - 1 Factor
12 Card Issuer Interactive Cardholder Verification - 2 Factor
13 Card Issuer Risk Oriented Non-Interactive Cardholder

fields.name: Authentication
fields.description: • 14 Card Issuer Asserted Authentication Visa Token Service - Issuer API Specifications (JSON) Encrypted Payload Data Structures 27 March 2025 Visa Confidential 61

fields.name: tokenRequestorName
fields.description: Token requester name. Populated when available in the following APIs:

fields.name: autoFillIndicator
fields.description: Indicates whether the token is for an autofill use case. This is a required field in the following APIs: on-File) is for an autofill use case. • false -- Indicates that the token is not for an autofill use case.
fields.format: It is one of the following values:
values: true -- Indicates that the token (e-Commerce Enabler, or Card-

fields.name: walletProviderRiskAssessment
fields.description: Wallet provider risk assessment. If the DWP sends the value, Visa will send it to the issuer. • 0-- Unconditionally approved. • 1-- Conditionally approved with further consumer verification. • 2-- Not approved
fields.format: It is one of the following values:

fields.name: walletProviderRiskAssessment
fields.description: Version If the DWP sends this information, Visa will send it to the issuer. May contain separators to indicate major and minor components, for example, periods, hyphens, slashes, and other similar characters. Visa Token Service - Issuer API Specifications (JSON) Encrypted Payload Data Structures 27 March 2025 Visa Confidential 62

fields.name: walletProviderAccountScore
fields.description: The wallet provider account score. Score value is between1 and 5, indicating the confidence level of the account, where 5 indicates the most confidence on the account.

fields.name: walletProviderDeviceScore
fields.description: The wallet provider device score. Score value is between1 and 5, indicating the confidence level of the device, where5 indicates the most confidence.

fields.name: walletProviderPhoneScore
fields.description: The wallet provider phone score. Score value is between1 and 5, indicating the confidence level of the phone number, where5 indicates the most confidence.

fields.name: walletProviderReasonCodes
fields.description: Wallet provider reason codes, in a comma-separated format.

fields.name: deviceBluetoothMac
fields.description: MAC address for Bluetooth.

fields.name: deviceIMEI
fields.description: Hardware ID of the device.

fields.name: deviceSerialNumber
fields.description: Serial number of the mobile device.

fields.name: deviceTimeZone
fields.description: Time-zone abbreviation.

fields.name: deviceTimeZoneSetting
fields.description: Device time-zone setting. • NETWORK_SET • CONSUMER_SET
fields.format: It is one of the following values:

fields.name: osID
fields.description: OS ID to allow building velocity and risk rules.

fields.name: simSerialNumber
fields.description: SIM serial number of the mobile device. Visa Token Service - Issuer API Specifications (JSON) Encrypted Payload Data Structures 27 March 2025 Visa Confidential 63

fields.name: deviceLostMode
fields.description: Number of days. Values are up to 9999 number of days.

fields.name: daysSinceConsumerDataLast
fields.description: AccountChange Number of days since account settings were changed (in case of a password update). If the number of days exceeds 9999, it will stay at 9999.

fields.name: accountHolderName
fields.description: Account-holder’s name.

fields.name: walletProviderPANAge
fields.description: Length of time (in days) that a PAN has been on file for a user.

fields.name: walletAccountHolderCardNameMatch
fields.description: Name of the account-holder and name of cardholder matched. • Y-- Indicates the two names match. • N-- Indicates the two names do not match.
fields.format: It is one of the following values:

fields.name: accountToDeviceBindingAge
fields.description: Number of days this device has been used by this account. If the number of days exceeds 9999, it will stay at 9999.

fields.name: userAccountAge
fields.description: Number of days since an account for this user has existed (how long have you known this user?). Values are 0 through 9999.

fields.name: walletAccountAge
fields.description: Number of days since the user created a wallet account or started using a wallet. If the number of days exceeds 256, it will stay at 256.

fields.name: walletAccountEmailAddressAge
fields.description: Number of days since the email address was associated with the account. If the number of days exceeds 999, it will stay at 999. Visa Token Service - Issuer API Specifications (JSON) Encrypted Payload Data Structures 27 March 2025 Visa Confidential 64

fields.name: provisioningAttemptsOnDevice
fields.description: In24Hours Number of provisioning attempts on this device in the past 24 hours. If the number of attempts exceeds 99, it will stay at 99.

fields.name: distinctCardholderNames
fields.description: Number of distinct cardholder names used in provisioning from this device.

fields.name: deviceCountry
fields.description: Country of device at time of provisioning.
fields.format: String; ISO 3166-1, alpha-2; max length 2 characters.

fields.name: walletAccountCountry
fields.description: Country of account-holder.
fields.format: String; ISO 3166-1, alpha-2; max length 2 characters.

fields.name: suspendedCardsInAccount
fields.description: Number of cards suspended in the account. If the number of days exceeds 99, it will stay at 99.

fields.name: daysSinceLastAccountActivity
fields.description: Number of days since the last activity on account. If the number of days exceeds 9999, it will stay at 9999.

fields.name: numberOfTransactionsInLast
fields.description: 12months Number of transactions on this account in the last 12 months. If the number of transaction exceeds 9999, it will stay at 9999.

fields.name: numberOfActiveTokens
fields.description: Number of active tokens on this account. If the number of tokens exceeds 99, it will stay at 99

fields.name: deviceWithActiveTokens
fields.description: Number of devices for this user with the same token. If the number of tokens exceeds 99, it will stay at 99 Visa Token Service - Issuer API Specifications (JSON) Encrypted Payload Data Structures 27 March 2025 Visa Confidential 65

fields.name: activeTokensOnAllDeviceFor
fields.description: Account Number of active tokens for this user, across all devices. If the number of tokens exceeds 9999, it will stay at 9999.

fields.name: visaTokenScore
fields.description: Value indicating the degree of risk associated with the token. Numeric value is 00 through 99. A value of 00 indicates no score provided by Visa.

fields.name: visaTokenDecisioning
fields.description: Results from the token provisioning service. • 00 - Provision and activate • 05 - Do not provision • 85 - Provision in inactive state (requires further consumer authentication prior to activation)
fields.format: It is one of the following values:

fields.name: riskAssessmentScore
fields.description: Values are 0 through 99. A higher value indicates a higher risk. This is calculated by the AA Risk Engine, based on the PAN’s transaction pattern (long term and short term).

fields.name: issuerSpecialConditionCodes
fields.description: Supported for issuers participating in 0100 TAR. The issuer can send values for this element in the 0100 TAR response. • If the issuer sends a value in the 0100 TAR, it will be sent in this element of the Get CVM. • If no value is sent in 0100 TAR or if the issuer does not participate in TAR, this element will not be present. Visa Token Service - Issuer API Specifications (JSON) Encrypted Payload Data Structures 27 March 2025 Visa Confidential 66

fields.name: deviceID
fields.description: For Secure Element (SE) wallet providers, this value will be the SE ID in hex binary characters transformed to a 48-character string. For Host Card Emulation (HCE) wallet providers, this field will be the Device ID as determined by the digital wallet provider (DWP). All alphanumeric and special characters are allowed for HCE DWPs. Secure Element (SE) ID represents the device ID. • For SE DWPs, this value will be the SE ID in hex binary characters transformed to a 48-character string. • For CBP DWPs, this field will be the device ID as determined by the DWP. All alphanumeric and special characters are allowed for CBP DWPs. For Card-on-File (COF) wallets, this value will not be present. For the initial Check Eligibility request on PAN enrollment, this value may not be available, however Visa will send this value if it is available.

fields.name: deviceLanguageCode
fields.description: This value is any ISO 639 Version 3 Language Code, for example, eng (English). This language code will be used by the issuer and Visa to retrieve the Terms and Conditions (T&C). If T&Cs are not found for the Language Code in the request, the T&Cs will return the default :anguage Code of eng (English). characters. Visa Token Service - Issuer API Specifications (JSON) Encrypted Payload Data Structures 27 March 2025 Visa Confidential 67
fields.format: String; ISO-639 Version 3 Language Code, max length 3

fields.name: deviceType
fields.description: Device type. Note: The deviceType field corresponds to Field 125, Usage 2 - Dataset ID 01 - Token Device, which is described in the VisaNet Authorization-Only Online Messages - Technical Specifications. • UNKNOWN • MOBILE_PHONE, which is equivalent to value 01 in Field 125 • TABLET, which is equivalent to value 02 in Field 125 • WATCH • MOBILEPHONE_OR_TABLET, which is equivalent to value 04 in Field 125 • PC • HOUSEHOLD_DEVICE • WEARABLE_DEVICE • AUTOMOBILE_DEVICE
fields.format: It is one of the following values:

fields.name: deviceName
fields.description: A readable name for the device. Ideally, the customer enters this name. It can be used to identify the device in customer support calls. characters.

fields.name: deviceNumber
fields.description: Device number.

fields.name: osType
fields.description: Type of operating system. • ANDROID • IOS • WINDOWS • BLACKBERRY • TIZEN • OTHER
fields.format: It is one of the following values:

fields.name: osVersion
fields.description: Version of the operating system running on the device. Visa Token Service - Issuer API Specifications (JSON) Encrypted Payload Data Structures 27 March 2025 Visa Confidential 68

fields.name: osBuildID
fields.description: Operating system build identifier.

fields.name: deviceIDType
fields.description: Attribute indicating the source of the Device ID value. SecureElement, TEE, or Derived
fields.example: The source for Device ID (deviceID) could be

fields.name: deviceManufacturer
fields.description: Manufacturer of the device.

fields.name: deviceBrand
fields.description: Brand name of the device.

fields.name: deviceModel
fields.description: model of the device.

fields.name: deviceLocation
fields.description: Obfuscated geographic location of the device. Initially, when provisioned, this contains the general location of the device. Information will be supplied with latitude/longitude rounded to the nearest whole digit.

fields.name: deviceIndex
fields.description: The index number from Visa where the deviceID is stored. This is required for token device binding.

fields.name: deviceIPAddressV4
fields.description: The IP address of the device at the time of the provisioning request, with the value represented in 255.255.255.255 format. An octet (255) may be 1-3 digits in length but cannot contain any leading zeros.

fields.name: locationSource
fields.description: Source used to identify consumer location. • WIFI • CELLULAR • GPS • OTHER Visa Token Service - Issuer API Specifications (JSON) Encrypted Payload Data Structures 27 March 2025 Visa Confidential 69
fields.format: It is one of the following values:

fields.name: tokenProtectionMethod
fields.description: Method of token protection. • SOFTWARE • TRUSTED_EXECUTION_ENVIRONMENT • SECURE_ELEMENT • CLOUD
fields.format: It is one of the following values:

fields.name: originalDeviceID
fields.description: Device ID from the original provision. This field is populated only when performing token-for-token provisioning and can be used only in the following APIs:

fields.name: originalDeviceType
fields.description: Device type from the original provision. This field is populated only when performing token-for-token provisioning and can be used only in the following APIs: Visa Token Service - Issuer API Specifications (JSON) Encrypted Payload Data Structures 27 March 2025 Visa Confidential 70

Device Information.format: It is one of the following values:

Risk Information.name: riskAssessmentScore
Risk Information.description: Advanced Authorization (AA) Risk Score is generated by VisaNet on the last payment transaction for the PAN. Values are 0 through 99, with a higher value indicating higher risk. This value is calculated by the AA Risk engine, based on the PAN’s transaction pattern (long-term and short-term). If available, it will be provided in Check Eligibility.

Risk Information.name: walletProviderRiskAssessment
Risk Information.description: Wallet provider risk assessment. If the DWP sends the value, Visa will send it to the issuer. • 0-- Unconditionally approved. • 1-- Conditionally approved with further consumer verification. • 2-- Not approved
Risk Information.format: It is one of the following values:

Risk Information.name: walletProviderRiskAssessment
Risk Information.description: Version If the DWP sends this information, Visa will send it to the issuer. May contain separators to indicate major and minor components, for example, periods, hyphens, slashes, and other similar characters. Visa Token Service - Issuer API Specifications (JSON) Encrypted Payload Data Structures 27 March 2025 Visa Confidential 62

Risk Information.name: walletProviderPhoneScore
Risk Information.description: The wallet provider phone score. Score value is between1 and 5, indicating the confidence level of the phone number, where5 indicates the most confidence.

Risk Information.name: walletProviderReasonCodes
Risk Information.description: Wallet provider reason codes, in a comma-separated format.

Risk Information.name: riskAssessmentScore
Risk Information.description: Values are 0 through 99. A higher value indicates a higher risk. This is calculated by the AA Risk Engine, based on the PAN’s transaction pattern (long term and short term).

Address.name: billingAddress
Address.description: Billing address associated with the payment instrument. It is required for Secure Remote Commerce.

Address.name: Address
Address.description: This structure is used by several APIs.

Address.name: city
Address.description: City associated with the address. (.), single quote (‘), asterisk (*), and hyphens (-) are allowed; max length 32 characters.
Address.format: String; alphanumeric; UTF-8, white space, carat (^), period

Address.name: state
Address.description: State or province code associated with the address.

Address.name: country
Address.description: Code for a country; default is US.
Address.format: String; ISO 3166-1 alpha-2; max length 2 characters.

Other Fields.name: expirationDate
Other Fields.description: The expiration date of the payment instrument. This is a required field for Secure Remote Commerce and in the following APIs:

Other Fields.name: highValueCustomer
Other Fields.description: If available, it will be provided in Check Eligibility. • true-- Indicates that the customer is high value. • false-- Indicates that the customer is not high value.
Other Fields.format: It is one of the following values:

Other Fields.name: month
Other Fields.description: The month upon which the payment instrument is set to expire.

Other Fields.name: year
Other Fields.description: The year upon which the payment instrument is set to expire. Visa Token Service - Issuer API Specifications (JSON) Encrypted Payload Data Structures 27 March 2025 Visa Confidential 58

Other Fields.name: Authentication
Other Fields.description: • 14 Card Issuer Asserted Authentication Visa Token Service - Issuer API Specifications (JSON) Encrypted Payload Data Structures 27 March 2025 Visa Confidential 61

Other Fields.name: autoFillIndicator
Other Fields.description: Indicates whether the token is for an autofill use case. This is a required field in the following APIs: on-File) is for an autofill use case. • false -- Indicates that the token is not for an autofill use case.
Other Fields.format: It is one of the following values:
values: true -- Indicates that the token (e-Commerce Enabler, or Card-

Other Fields.name: simSerialNumber
Other Fields.description: SIM serial number of the mobile device. Visa Token Service - Issuer API Specifications (JSON) Encrypted Payload Data Structures 27 March 2025 Visa Confidential 63

Other Fields.name: daysSinceConsumerDataLast
Other Fields.description: AccountChange Number of days since account settings were changed (in case of a password update). If the number of days exceeds 9999, it will stay at 9999.

Other Fields.name: numberOfTransactionsInLast
Other Fields.description: 12months Number of transactions on this account in the last 12 months. If the number of transaction exceeds 9999, it will stay at 9999.

Other Fields.name: issuerSpecialConditionCodes
Other Fields.description: Supported for issuers participating in 0100 TAR. The issuer can send values for this element in the 0100 TAR response. • If the issuer sends a value in the 0100 TAR, it will be sent in this element of the Get CVM. • If no value is sent in 0100 TAR or if the issuer does not participate in TAR, this element will not be present. Visa Token Service - Issuer API Specifications (JSON) Encrypted Payload Data Structures 27 March 2025 Visa Confidential 66
